reviews.name: Beth
reviews.comments: I have a soft spot for this place, so many good meals with good friends and family. Over the years, however, I have had some pretty amazing Thai food and while Thai Siam is always satisfying I don’t think it is the best of the best. Prices are still very reasonable, though and their menu is extensive. I still would recommend it for an excellent Thai meal.

reviews.name: John
reviews.comments: Oof, I told them they couldn't make it hot enough for me, but I was wrong!

reviews.name: Beth
reviews.comments: Excellent vegetarian food in a really comfy atmosphere. I always feel good in every way for eating here. Someone at the table always orders the vegetables and tofu on brown rice. So simple and SOOO good. This time I had the Ratatouille with Parmesan polenta which was also very satisfying. Although in a new location, it’s still warm and inviting with big windows and lots of live plants, same super friendly staff.

reviews.name: Sean
reviews.comments: The day I could order one of their burritos without having to split it with both my mom and sister was the day I became a man.

reviews.name: Megan
reviews.comments: This place has really become a staple and highly esteemed tradition in my household. So many holidays, birthdays, and even the occasional family gathering are celebrated around the circular rotating tables and carts of Dim Sum. As a fan of all the shrimp-themed dishes, it's always a delight to watch my family members attempt to eat the ever popular chicken feet or make a kebab out of the coconut shrimp balls. The only downside is that the parking situation is both small and complicated, but there is always a friendly parking attendant to usher you into the perfect spot.

reviews.name: Caryn
reviews.comments: Neighborhood bakery, delicious Danish-style pastries as well as cakes, cookies, and donuts. Their signature - and my favorite - is the Kringle, a delight both for the holidays and literally any other time of the year. Always fun to see what seasonal & thematic cupcakes they have. Solid coffee game too, including a 'flavor of the day' latte. Reasonable amount of seating along the windows. Grateful this is in walking distance for me!

reviews.name: Caryn
reviews.comments: Cozy interior, pleasant service, delicious food, and reasonable prices. Solid place for pho and lemongrass tofu.

reviews.name: Beth
reviews.comments: Friendly staff, excellent food. We had something from each section of the menu, so for just the two of us there was extra to take home. While I enjoyed the food, there was nothing that “wowed” me, so I’m not sure it was worth the price. We walked—parking may have been difficult.

reviews.name: Megan
reviews.comments: With the pandemic keeping everyone indoors, it's really nice to be able to order from one of my favorite restaurants. The razorback dumplings are far superior to any other dumplings in my opinion, but the limited amount of sour cream and the inability to request more dampens the experience.

reviews.name: Sean
reviews.comments: I could eat a 5-gallon bucket of The Classic with potato filling; but, dang, they keep it kinda cold in there... maybe it's authentic to their Siberian theme.

reviews.name: Beth
reviews.comments: So one of the best things about this place was that it was open really late and we could have both savory and sweet pies after 11pm as well as a “pietini”. We ordered one of each and everything was excellent. Perhaps focusing just on pies means you can really perfect your skills. We had a mushroom, vegetables and cheese slice and a Ballard bumble berry crumble. The former came with salad and the latter with ice cream. It was all that two people needed at a reasonable price. Great service, clean and comfortable.
